chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael N Exner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operating While Revoked (Forfeiture). This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Bail applied to fine.   Any remaining fine to be paid within 90 days or penalty of 2 years suspension of Driver's License for non-payment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael N Exner

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Michael N Exner in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant makes statements requesting an adjournment.  Court denies request.  Case remains on for trial.  Attorney Galaviz makes appearance.  Attorney Galaviz moves to amend the OAR to an ordinance.  Defendant pleads no contest to amended count #2. Court finds the defendant guilty of amended count #2.  Count #1 is dismissed and read in.  State makes recommendations.  Defendant makes statements.  
The Court Orders the Following to count #2:
FINE: $200.50  Bail to be applied. 
Total amounts due to be paid within 90 days .  Failure to pay; the Court orders alternate 2 year driver license suspension
Filed by the State. Witness list attached.
Jury trial - 12 person on October 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury status hearing on October 15, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Michael N Exner in court.  Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant does not know if he will obtain counsel.  Defendant has not yet requested discovery.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for October 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury status hearing scheduled for October 15, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed and comply with all restrictions, including having the IID in his car.   Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing

Defendant Michael N Exner in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant to apply at Public Defender's Office for representation.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for August 17, 2015 at 09:30 am.
